name: afraid

afraid adjective
(FEAR)
Add to word list

A2 [ after verb ] feeling fear, or feeling worry about the possible results of a particular situation: afraid for She was afraid for her children (= feared that they might be hurt).afraid of I've always been afraid of flying/heights/spiders. He was/felt suddenly afraid. [ + to infinitive ] Don't be afraid to say what you think. [ + (that) ] She was afraid (that) he might be upset if she told him. Synonyms
frightened
petrified (FRIGHTENED)
scared
terrified

afraid adjective
(SORRY)
I'm afraid...
A2 used to politely introduce bad news or disagreement: This is your room - it's rather small, I'm afraid.
See more I'm afraid not (also afraid not)
used to politely say "no": "Was she impressed with our work?" "I'm afraid not."
See more I'm afraid so
(also afraid so) used to say "yes" or agree with something though you are sad or upset over that thing : "Does this mean I've got to leave?" "I'm afraid so."
